column2: Document Title: ITP-261-RAIL-PSD-Aluminothermic Welding and Stressing
ITP Description: Aluminothermic Welding and Stressing

Reference: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street

1.11 Non-Destructive Hand Testing Of Rail - Track Procedure

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Weld kits supplied are within expiry period and conform to the requirements of applicable standards.

REFERENCE: A4263 PTDT Form B - Track Certifier Booking Form
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off

VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: AS1085.20 Railway Track Material Part 1: Steel Rails

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: WPS (Welding Procedure Specifications), WPQR (Welding Procedure Qualification Records), WQR (Welder Qualification Register)
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: AS1085.20 Railway Track Material Part 1: Steel Rails
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Verify Aluminothermic welding carried out in accordance with AS1085.20
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: AS1085.20 Railway Track Material Part 1: Steel Rails
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Alignment inspection shall be carried out on each weld and record results.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: AS1085.20 Railway Track Material Part 1: Steel Rails
○ A1340 Flash Butt Welding Specification Section 4.3.5
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Stamp ID on the field side of the rail head adjacent to the weld.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: AS1085.20 Railway Track Material Part 1: Steel Rails
○ A4598 Welded Track Management Metro Track - Chapter 10 - Closure Rails Procedure Table 7.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure track lengths area stressing accordance with Metro Track - Management Chapter 11 Welding Process Procedure (A4200),
○ Minimum Closure Length taken as 13. 7 meters if not Detailed in Welded Track Management Metro Track - Chapter 10 - Closure Rails Procedure (A4598) table 7.
RESPONSIBILITY: SE/PE, Track Supervisor, Track Surveyor
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: A4589 Welded Track Management Chapter 9 Stress Control for Continuous Welded Rail Procedure Section 5.1.2
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The design SFT is 38°C and all stressing is to be carried out to this design SFT.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: A4588 Welded Track Management - Chapter 13 - Monitoring of Welded Track Procedure
○ AS 1085.11 Permanent Way Material – Head-hardened Rail, Figure C2.
○ A4589 Welded Track Management Chapter 9 Stress Control for Continuous Welded Rail Procedure Section 6.20
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ultrasonic testing to be carried out within 14 days and in accordance with A4588 Welded Track Management - Chapter 13 - Monitoring of Welded Track Procedure
○ The cross section of the area of the head and web shall be completely scanned;
— The foot area shall be scanned in accordance with AS 1085.11 Permanent Way Material – Head-hardened Rail, Figure C2.
— Welds shall be scanned to both directions.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: A4589 Welded Track Management Chapter 9 Stress Control for Continuous Welded Rail Procedure Section 6.21
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Complete Stressing Recorded documentation
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: MTMF020000-1 – Track Form A T
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: - Track Geometry Conformance Certificate
FREQUENCY: Once (upon completion of occupation works)
RESPONSIBILITY: Nominated Authority (MTM Infrastructure Track Certifier), Project Cert III Rail Infrastructure
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
○ Attach: Relevant Conformance Certs as per acceptance criteria

VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.

REFERENCE: IFC Drawings: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Correct line and level established for placement of Sleepers and Ballast as per IFC.
RESPONSIBILITY: SE/PE, Track Supervisor, Track Surveyor
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
○ Attach: Survey Records & Photos on site
REFERENCE: PTC Heavy Rail Track Construction Standards Drawing F598
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ballast to be placed in 150mm max layers. Bottom Ballast to be left 20-40mm below final design level – Tolerance (under sleeper) -0mm, +25mm
RESPONSIBILITY: SE/PE, Track Supervisor, Track Surveyor
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
○ Attach: Survey Records & Photos on site
REFERENCE: A1303 Track Geometry Tolerances Table 1
○ A4597 Welded Track Management Manual Chapter 7 - Requirements For Welding Track Procedure Section 4.8
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sleepers Square at nominal 685mm ±25mm.
○ 2 concrete sleepers either side of welds
○ Up to 50mm variation in spacing to allow for clearance around a thermit weld (only over two sleepers)
RESPONSIBILITY: SE/PE, Track Supervisor, Track Surveyor
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
○ Attach: Survey Records & Photos on site
REFERENCE: A4598 Welded Track Management Metro Track - Chapter 10 - Closure Rails Procedure Section 4.1.1, 4.1.2 and Table 7
○ Aluminothermic Weld and Stressing - Inspection and Test Plan
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plain line Aluminothermic welds square and centrally located in beds.
○ Alignment inspection shall be carried out on each weld and record results.
○ Rail ends identified & clearly marked for visibility of joint.
○ All fastenings must be fully applied.
○ Minimum Closure Length taken as 13. 7meters if not Detailed in A4598 table 7.
○ Complete Aluminothermic Weld and Stressing - Refer to Aluminothermic Weld and Stressing ITP
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: PTC Heavy Rail Track Construction Standards Drawing F598
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sleeper alignment complies to square with centreline for tangent track.
○ Rail jewellery secure and installed correctly
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
○ A1536 Transit Space Clearances Figure 1 and section 9.2
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tamp track as per IFC design and within below tolerances:
○ A minimum horizontal clearance of 3.0m from track centreline to structure.
○ Height and Stagger readings of overhead wire to ensure minimum clearance of 4.61m is not breached
METHOD: Visual Inspection, Tamping Geometry Recording, Measure / Survey Pickup
RESPONSIBILITY: Tamping Operator, Track Surveyor, Overhead Engineer, Track Supervisor, SE/PE
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: A1537 Earthworks And Formation Standard Section 9
○ PTC Heavy Rail Track Construction Standards Drawing F598
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As per IFC drawings; 405mm from sleeper end tangent track
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Track survey to be carried out at completion of works. Track levels compared to IFC and ensure tolerances are met
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off

FREQUENCY: Once (upon completion of occupation works)

Document Title: ITP-263-RAIL-PSD-Track Formation - Capping Layer
ITP Description: Track Formation - Capping Layer
ITP approved for use by: Romualdo Magpantay
1.1 Drawing Pack - Rail Track and Civil
Reference: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
1.2 Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Specification
1.3 Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Standard
1.4 Australian Standard - Methods of testing soils for engineering purposes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Capping material shall comply with the following grading requirements:
FREQUENCY: Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Material approval in TeamBinder, This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.12.5. Table 7, AS1289 Tests
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The following tests shall be carried out on samples of the capping layer material:
— Soaked CBR - minimum 50% compacted to 98% modified dry density
FREQUENCY: Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Material approval in TeamBinder, This ITP Signed Off
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.12.5. Table 7, AS1289 Tests
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Responsible Engineer.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of fill works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative signoff
REFERENCE: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of fill works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.1 Capping Layer Preparation and Installation (1 of 3)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Capping layer shall be constructed in one layer and compacted to a total compacted thickness of no less than 150mm.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP Signed Off, MTM representative Signoff
5.2 Capping Layer Preparation and Installation (2 of 3)
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.12.5. Table 7, AS1289 Tests
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The following tests shall be carried out on samples of the capping layer material:
○ Soaked CBR - minimum 50% compacted to 98% modified dry density
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.3 Capping Layer Preparation and Installation (3 of 3)
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof roll as per L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 4.6.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative Signoff
6.1 Survey Conformance / Capping Layer Finishing and Tolerances
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The finished surface level of capping layer shall:
— Be within -25 to +0mm of approved design level
— Be within 10mm of algebraic difference of the deviations from the correct level for any two points 20m apart on the centreline
— Be within -0mm to +10mm of 3m straightedge laid on final capping layer surface parallel and perpendicular to centreline
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
Document Title: ITP-264-RAIL-PSD-Track Formation - General Fill
ITP Description: Track Formation - General Fill
ITP approved for use by: Romualdo Magpantay
1.1 Drawing Pack - Rail Track and Civil
Reference: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
1.2 Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Specification
1.3 Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Standard
1.4 Australian Standard - Methods of testing soils for engineering purposes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: General Fill shall consist of suitable material that shall be compacted to a minimum characteristic value of density ratio 98%
FREQUENCY: Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Material approval in TeamBinder, This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: General fill shall comply with the criteria listed in
— Dispersion (Emerson class number of soil) - not to be class 1 or 2
— Collapse strain - to be agreed by MTM geotechnical engineer
FREQUENCY: Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Material approval in TeamBinder, This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Responsible Engineer.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of fill works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative signoff
REFERENCE: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of fill works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.1 General Fill Preparation and Installation - For track constructed on embankment (1 of 2)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any surface on which fills are to be constructed shall be proof rolled.
○ All layers of general fill material shall be compacted to a minimum characteristic value of density ratio of 98% (Standard Compaction)
○ Where a layers to be constructed in fill it shall be constructed in uniform thickness not exceeding 200mm lose.
— Volume < 1000m³ atleast one set of tests shall be carried out
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.2 General Fill Preparation and Installation - For track constructed on embankment (2 of 2)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: General fill shall comply with the criteria listed in
— Dispersion (Emerson class number of soil) - not to be class 1 or 2
— Collapse strain - to be agreed by MTM geotechnical engineer
— Volume < 1000m³ atleast one set of tests shall be carried out
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof roll as per L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 5.10.3.1.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative Signoff
6.1 General Fill Finishing and Tolerances - For track constructed on embankment / Survey Conformance
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: General fill on embankments shall be installed within +/- 40mm of approved design surface level
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
Document Title: ITP-265-RAIL-PSD-Track Formation - Structural Fill
ITP Description: Track Formation - Structural Fill
ITP approved for use by: Romualdo Magpantay
1.1 Drawing Pack - Rail Track and Civil
Reference: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
1.2 Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Specification
1.3 Metro Engineering Specifications - Earthworks & Formation Standard
1.4 Australian Standard - Methods of testing soils for engineering purposes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural fill materias shall have the following properties:
FREQUENCY: Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Material approval in TeamBinder, This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural fill must comply with the following requirements:
FREQUENCY: Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Material approval in TeamBinder, This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Responsible Engineer.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of fill works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative signoff
REFERENCE: MRP-DPK-091-00-CPW-0063 Rail Track & Civil Drawings - Progress Street
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out pegs in place and clearly mark out limits of works.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of fill works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.1 Structural Fill Preparation and Installation - (1 of 3)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where Rail Subgrade CBR < 3%:
— Required minimum depth of structural fill is 1000mm
— 8% min CBR, Compacted to 100% (Standard Compaction Test)
○ Where a layers to be constructed in fill it shall be constructed in uniform thickness not exceeding 200mm lose.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.2 Structural Fill Preparation and Installation - (2 of 3)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where Rail Subgrade 3% < CBR < 8%:
— Required minimum depth of structural fill is 500mm
— 8% min CBR, Compacted to 100% (Standard Compaction Test)
○ Where a layers to be constructed in fill it shall be constructed in uniform thickness not exceeding 200mm lose.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.3 Structural Fill Preparation and Installation - (3 of 3)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where Rail Subgrade CBR > 8%:
— Structural fill can directly be placed onto subgrade and compacted to 100%
— 8% min CBR, Compacted to 100% (Standard Compaction Test)
○ Where a layers to be constructed in fill it shall be constructed in uniform thickness not exceeding 200mm lose.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof roll as per L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 4.6.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative Signoff
6.1 Structural Fill Finishing and Tolerances - For track constructed on embankment / Survey Conformance
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural fill shall be within +0 to -35mm of approved design surface level
○ Structural fill shall be within +0 to +50mm of 3m straightedge laid on final structural surface parallel and perpendicular to centreline
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.

○ Collapse strain - to be agreed by MTM geotechnical engineer
FREQUENCY: Once, for each material type - prior to works commencement

5.1 Subgrade Preparation and Installation - For track constructed on embankment (1 of 3)
If general fill is to be placed directly over subgrade:
If structural fill is to be placed directly over subgrade:
— Subgrade shall be scarified to 200mm and re-compacted to 100%
○ Volume < 1000m³ atleast one set of tests shall be carried out
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.2 Subgrade Preparation and Installation - For track constructed on embankment (2 of 3)
If general fill is to be placed directly over subgrade
— Subgrade to be compacted to 98% (Standard Compaction Test)
If structural fill is to be placed directly over subgrade
— Subgrade shall be scarified to 200mm and re-compacted to 100% (Standard Compaction Test)
○ Volume < 1000m³ atleast one set of tests shall be carried out
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
5.3 Subgrade Preparation and Installation - For track constructed on embankment (3 of 3)
— Excavation can be stopped to suit capping layer or at top of section with CBR > 8%
— Subgrade shall be scarified to 200mm and re-compacted to 100% (Standard Compaction Test)
○ Volume < 1000m³ atleast one set of tests shall be carried out
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof roll as per L1-CHE-SPE-178 - Clause 4.6.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off, MTM representative Signoff
6.1 Subgrade Finishing and Tolerances - For track constructed on embankment / Survey Conformance
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subgrade on embankments shall be installed within +/- 40mm of approved design surface level
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP Signed Off
